node.title: Elopement is on the rise but could it be a pandemic trend?
node.alt: man and woman standing in rainforest in wedding attire with bouquet of flowers
node.description: The COVID pandemic may have kickstarted itÂ but there's a growing trend for couples choosing to elope, with surprising results.
node.content:
["Claire Mathieu and Adam Coughlan tied the knot on a private beach in Far North Queensland with just two witnesses and their young children in attendance.\u00a0", "They had been together for 13 years and engaged for three, but the wedding was planned in just four days.", "\"We always thought of doing an elopement and it was reinforced with COVID,\" Ms Mathieu said.\u00a0", "\"I fell pregnant with my son, so it was a bit of an engagement baby, so we had to postpone \u2026 then COVID-19 hit, then I fell pregnant again.", "\"Because we got delayed already, we didn't want to wait much longer.\"", "", "
Claire Mathieu says the ceremony was\u00a0intimate and special.(Supplied:\u00a0Claire Mathieu)
", "It was a rush to organise and\u00a0her dress didn't arrive in time, but Ms Mathieu\u00a0said the intimacy of an elopement far outweighed\u00a0the benefit of a big ceremony.\u00a0", "Jessica Pynappels and her new husband Scott had a similar experience. They found\u00a0the absence of guests meant\u00a0the delivery of their vows was\u00a0more intimate and special.", "\"I didn't realise how intimate that moment would be, not having anyone else around. We were really in the moment,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Jessica and Scott had planned a big wedding but family and friends were stuck interstate due to COVID-19 restrictions.(Supplied: Lukas Teasdale Photography.)
", "The Gold Coast couple had planned for a big wedding, but border restrictions kept some of their guest list out of Queensland.\u00a0", "\"We decided to cancel the wedding and elope instead,\" Ms Pynappels said.\u00a0", "\"It was not at all what we had planned.", "\"I would recommend it to everybody. It was so much more memorable.\"", "", "
The Pynappels were together for 12 years before they were married\u00a0on Fitzroy Island\u00a0in a ceremony in front of their children.\u00a0\u00a0(Supplied: Lukas Teasdale Photography)
", "
Ditching the big ceremony\u00a0
", "Gold Coast wedding photographer Konrad Krynicki said that\u00a0before the pandemic struck, one in six couples he photographed was\u00a0eloping.\u00a0", "Mr Krynicki said the pandemic had given couples a good excuse to get hitched\u00a0without the fuss.\u00a0", "\"Now it's socially acceptable to elope, there's tonnes of benefits to it,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It's less stressful because you're doing it your way. It's more intimate, more romantic.\"", "The wedding industry had\u00a0taken a hit throughout the pandemic, as cancelled or rescheduled events resulted in vendors losing work.", "For Mr Krynicki, photographing an elopement was the difference between a three-hour work day opposed to an eight-hour day.\u00a0", "", "
Wedding photographer\u00a0Konrad Krynicki says up to 50 per cent\u00a0of his jobs are elopements.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Konrad Krynicki)
", "Cairns-based marriage celebrant Tammy Barker said the trend had been tough on suppliers, but had many positives.", "\"When you have a small wedding or\u00a0an elopement there's a lot less waste, there's a lot less travel, there's a lot fewer\u00a0purchases. From an eco point of view, that's a brilliant thing,\" Ms Barker said.\u00a0", "
Are elopements here to stay?
", "While Ms Barker saw\u00a0elopements\u00a0skyrocket during the pandemic, she said big weddings would come back.\u00a0", "\"I think we'll see it definitely for a few years, but I wouldn't be surprised if big weddings come back thick and strong.\"", "Mr Krynicki said couples should do what suited them.", "\"If it's always been your dream to have a huge, classical, elegant wedding, then go for it,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Just because everyone is getting eloped doesn't mean you have to do it.\"\u00a0"]
